description: eigen- +‎ value, a partial calque of German Eigenwert.

entries.meaning:
(linear algebra) A scalar, 
  
    
      
        λ
      
    
    {\displaystyle \lambda }
  
, such that there exists a non-zero vector 
  
    
      
        x
      
    
    {\displaystyle x}
  
 (a corresponding eigenvector) for which the image of 
  
    
      
        x
      
    
    {\displaystyle x}
  
 under a given linear operator 
  
    
      
        
          A
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle \mathrm {A} }
  
 is equal to the image of 
  
    
      
        x
      
    
    {\displaystyle x}
  
 under multiplication by 
  
    
      
        λ
      
    
    {\displaystyle \lambda }
  
; i.e. 
  
    
      
        
          A
        
        x
        =
        λ
        x
      
    
    {\displaystyle \mathrm {A} x=\lambda x}
  
.
examples:
The eigenvalues 
  
    
      
        λ
      
    
    {\displaystyle \lambda }
  
 of a square transformation matrix 
  
    
      
        
          M
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle \mathrm {M} }
  
 may be found by solving 
  
    
      
        det
        (
        
          M
        
        −
        λ
        
          I
        
        )
        =
        0
      
    
    {\displaystyle \det(\mathrm {M} -\lambda \mathrm {I} )=0}
  
.
